p: Furthermore, Wang et al. [ 68] investigated the anthelmintic activity from Paris polyphylla and found two steroidal saponins: dioscin and polyphyllin D, obtained from its methanolic extract, that exhibited significant activity against Dactylogyrus intermedius with EC 50 values of 0.44 and 0.70 mg/L, respectively. These were more potent than the positive control, mebendazole (EC 50 value = 1.25 mg/L).
